alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Suffolk; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Isle of Wight, southeastern York and east central Surry Counties, the western City of Poquoson, the northeastern City of Suffolk, the City of Hampton and the City of Newport News through 345 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crittenden, or near Smithfield, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Isle Of Wight around 305 PM EDT. Smithfield and Rescue around 315 PM EDT. Christopher Newport University and Beaconsdale around 325 PM EDT. Patrick Henry Field, Fort Eustis and Denbigh around 340 PM EDT. Newport News around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rushmere, Carrollton, Chippokes State Park, Longview, Benns Church, Oriana, Huntersville, Bethel Church, Hilton Village and Chuckatuck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Suffolk; Surry; York
